choices.A: Data Sync can connect to any jdbc compatible source like MongoDB, RedShift and Sybase.
choices.D: Data Sync has default drivers available that supported loading data from DB2, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL and Teradata.
choices.C: Data Sync can load your data in parallel in order to speed up the loading process.
choices.B: Data Sync can use a normal OCI (thick) client connection to connect to an Oracle database.

discussion.content:
Correct Ans: A and C
As Oracle Data Sync has no Default Drivers - It's all through JDBC only and Parallelism is a supported feature.

Selected Answer: AC
I think AC
I think A D more accurate

By default, Data Sync installs the Oracle JDBC driver only. If you need to connect to a different database type (for example, Microsoft SQL Server, or DB2) or if you want to use a different Oracle driver from the default, then you must manually copy required files to the lib directory.

If you need to connect to a different database type (for example, Microsoft SQL
Server, or DB2) or if you want to use a different Oracle driver from the default,
then you must manually copy required files to the lib directory.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true with regards to Oracle Data Sync? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B
tpurgent: The highest priority application connection service for time critical transaction processing operations. This connection service supports manual parallelism.

tp: A typical application connection service for transaction processing operations. Queries run serially.

high: A high priority application connection service for reporting and batch operations with low concurrency requirements. All operations run in parallel (if you have multiple OCPU assigned to your instance) and are subject to queuing.

medium: A typical application connection service for reporting and batch operations. All operations run in parallel and are subject to queuing.

low: A lowest priority application connection service for high concurrency reporting or batch processing operations. Queries run serially.
B is correct. LOW: Least resources, highest concurrency. Queries run serially.

B is correct because of the second part which says DoP = 1, because low service queries can use inly 1 CPU so there is no parallel query processing. C is partially true but is wrong because queries using High can multiple CPU so parallel processing can be achieved there
B is the correct answer

LA RESPUESTA CORRECTA ES C, SE PUEDE CONFIRMAR EN EL SEGUIENTE LINK https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/adwud/predefined-database-service-names.html#GUID-D94714F3-C6FC-45E2-8E80-07A08DB47FFE

comments.content: Perd√≥n la correcta es B con toda seguridad.

discussion.content: Answer is B .DOP for low is 1, for medium is 4 and for high can be more than 1 and depends upon ocpu count.
B is answer. A is just wrong and C and D high is more than one parallel so B is only solution left

B
https://danischnider.files.wordpress.com/2019/07/kscope19_autonomous_data_warehouse.pdf
B is correct as in Low : queries run serially so DoP (Degree of parallelism is 1), In HIGH Queries run in parallel and DoP can be more than 1
B is correct

Correct C: 
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/manage-priorities.html#GUID-80E464A7-8ED4-45BB-A7D6-E201DD4107B7

The basic characteristics of these consumer groups are:

HIGH: Highest resources, lowest concurrency. Queries run in parallel.
MEDIUM: Less resources, higher concurrency. Queries run in parallel.
LOW: Least resources, highest concurrency. Queries run serially.

questions.question_text:
Users are required to select a service when connecting to Autonomous Data Warehouse and these services match to one of three different consumer groups:
High, Medium, and Low.
Which statement about these consumer groups is correct?

choices.C: High provides highest resources, lowest concurrency, and DoP is 1.
choices.D: High provides highest concurrency and lowest resources, and DoP is 1.
choices.A: Medium provides intermediate resource and concurrency, and queries run in a serial.
choices.B: Low provides highest concurrency, lowest resources, and DoP =1.

choices.C: The Wallet for the Autonomous Database is the same as the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) wallet.
choices.D: You MUST have an Oracle Client Credential Wallet in order to connect to the Autonomous Database.
choices.B: The Oracle Client Credential file is downloaded as a ZIP file.
choices.A: In addition to the Oracle Client Credential Wallet, a user must have a username and password in order to connect to the Autonomous Database.

discussion.content: Correct Ans: C
